item.title: In 2014, Facebook dominated the social network advertising market in terms of spending
item.description:
In 2014, global spending on social network advertising saw a 41% increase, reaching over US$15.3 billion and representing 11% of all digital ad spending, according to a Global Social Network Forecast from Strategy Analytics. Facebook dominated this sector, securing three-quarters of global social network ad spend, while Twitter captured 8%. Projections for 2015 anticipate continued growth in social network ad spending, estimated to reach US$24.2 billion, a 29% rise. Leika Kawasaki, the report’s author, highlights the robust expansion of the social network market across all regions...
